quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Iceland and Vermont
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, nicknames, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these actions is illegal according to the child protection laws in Iceland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the capital city of the U.S. state of Vermont?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montpelier

questions.question: What popular musician was born and raised in Iceland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bjork

questions.question: What type of animal meat is used for the preparation of the traditional Icelandic meal Hangikjot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lamb

questions.question: What is the state mammal of the U.S. state of Vermont?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horse

questions.question: What was the only native land mammal in Iceland when humans arrived?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arctic Fox

questions.question: Which of these nicknames refers to the U.S. state of Vermont?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Mountain State

questions.question: What is the official language adopted by the government of Iceland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Icelandic and Faroese

questions.question: What design is depicted on the national flag of Iceland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cross

questions.question: Which of these animals is featured on the national coat of arms of Iceland as a protector of the island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bull

questions.question: The title of the national anthem of Iceland is Lofsongur. What does this mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hymn

questions.question: The U.S. state of Vermont has been the leading producer in the country of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maple syrup

questions.question: What religious denomination does the National Church of Iceland belong to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lutheran

questions.question: What is the capital and largest city of Iceland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reykjavik

questions.question: This annual prestigious sport competition, held in Monaco, was organized for the first time in 1929 by Anthony Noghès.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monaco Grand Prix

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Vermont and Preparation
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, festival, pranahara. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the meaning of the name of England, which is derived from an Old English word?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land of the Angles

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the U.S. state of Vermont?

options.text: It was the last U.S. state to be admitted to the Union.
It is the least populous U.S. state.
It is the smallest U.S. state.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What traditional Indian beverage is made from female Cannabis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bhang

questions.question: Name the official state flower of the U.S. state of Vermont.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clover

questions.question: What vegetable is used in the preparation of the traditional Indian dish called Charchari?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What fruit is used for the preparation of fenny, a popular Indian alcoholic beverage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coconut

questions.question: What is the English name commonly used to refer to the popular Indian dish Murgh Makhani?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Butter chicken

questions.question: What is the literal translation of the word pranahara, used commonly by some people to refer to the traditional Indian sweets called Sandesh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heart stealer

questions.question: Which of these describes best the spring season in the U.S. state of Vermont?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mud season

questions.question: Which festival is held annually on Columbus Day Weekend in the U.S. state of Vermont?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apple Festival

questions.question: Which of the following is the most popular drink in all parts of India?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tea

questions.question: What type of meal is the Idli, which is very popular in South India?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A cake

questions.question: What type of syrup is used for the preparation of the sweet Indian drink called Falooda?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rose syrup

questions.question: Chicken tikka is a traditional Indian meal. What does tikka mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pieces

questions.question: What is the name of the traditional South Indian crepe made from rice and black lentils and eaten for breakfast or dinner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dosa

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: England and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the largest and most populous city in England, and in the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: London

questions.question: Which of these prominent scientist was not English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Niels Bohr

questions.question: Who signed the Lateran Treaty on behalf of King Victor Emmanuel III of Italy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benito Mussolini

questions.question: What are the colors on the English flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White and red

questions.question: What is the name of Robin Hoods gang that is a popular part of English folklore?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Merry Men

questions.question: The State of the Vatican City is a landlocked city-state situated within the city of Rome.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who is head of state and head of government of Vatican City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pope

questions.question: What is the official religion in England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anglicanism

questions.question: What is the name of the river which flows through central London, the capital of England and the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thames

questions.question: In what country was Pope Benedict XVI born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany

questions.question: What are the basic ingredients of the traditional full English breakfast?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eggs and bacon

questions.question: What is the name of the official national anthem of England?

options.text: I Vow to Thee, My Country

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: In what palace is the famous Sistine Chapel located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apostolic Palace

questions.question: What year was the Vatican City established?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1929

questions.question: What flower has become a national symbol of England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rose

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Constantinople and Year
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, constantinople, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Where is the Vatican City located?

options.text: on Vatican Hill in the west-central part of Rome
on Vatican Hill outside of Rome
on Vatican Hill in the east-central part of Rome

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: on Vatican Hill in the west-central part of Rome

questions.question: What is the form of government in the Vatican City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monarchy

questions.question: St. Peters Basilica is the official ecclesiastical seat of the Pope.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Constantinople was never the capital of this empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mongol Empire

questions.question: How much time did it take to build Constantinople?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Over six years

questions.question: Which architectural landmark is considered the epitome of Byzantine architecture in Constantinople?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hagia Sophia

questions.question: This tradition of course camarguaise is anchored in several French departments. Which one is not among them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lozère

questions.question: Constantinople is located between the Golden Horn and this sea.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Sea of Marmara

questions.question: The only official language of the Vatican city is Italian.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what year was Constantinople renamed Istanbul?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1930

questions.question: Name the archbishop of Constantinople who became spiritual leader of the Orthodox church in 1991.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bartholomew

questions.question: What place of historical importance in Constantinople is known nowadays as Sultan Ahmet Square?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hippodrome

questions.question: Constantinople was established by Roman emperor Constantine I around 330 AD on the site of the ancient Greek city Byzantium.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What year was Constantinople invaded by the Turkish army of Mohamed II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1453

questions.question: The Anastasian Wall was part of an outer defense system of Constantinople.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Canada and Course
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A leaf of what tree is featured on the national flag of Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maple tree

questions.question: Which word refers to the men practicing course camarguaise?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raseteurs

questions.question: What is the largest city in Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toronto

questions.question: What was the largest ethnic group among the population of Canada according to the 2006 census?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English

questions.question: Which term refers to the people who help the young participants in course camarguaise to place correctly the bull in front of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tourneurs

questions.question: What is the meaning of the St. Lawrence Iroquoian word kanata from which the name of Canada originated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Settlement

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: O Canada

questions.question: Which of the following is the link between the course camarguaise and the USA?

options.text: Course camarguaise is planned to be part of the X games.
Some Southern French Huguenots settled in Florida and brought back these bull traditions. Thus they contributed in the birth of rodeo.
Buffalo Bill and the Marquis Folco de Baroncelli-Javon were close friends.
Some investors want to bring it back to Texas in order to make more profit.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buffalo Bill and the Marquis Folco de Baroncelli-Javon were close friends.

questions.question: The objective in course camarguaise is to snatch several attributes fixed on the bulls horns. Which one is not among them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La jarretière

questions.question: Music plays an important role in the French style of bullfighting, course camarguaise. What music is played every time something impressive happens in the arena?

options.text: Claude Debussy - En blanc et noir

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Georges Bizet - Carmen

questions.question: This person contributed to the revival of the course camarguaise, as well as to the to improvement in breeding of the Camarguese bull and to the codifying of the rules of the game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marquis Folco de Baroncelli-Javon

questions.question: There is a French federation of course camarguaise.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the official language of the citizens of Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English and French

questions.question: What is the definition of the term bandido?

options.text: Bulls are running from the fields to the arena through the village.
Bulls are enclosed in some streets in order to be played with.
Bulls are running from the arena to the fields through the village.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bulls are running from the arena to the fields through the village.

questions.question: What is the definition of the term abrivado, which is related to the style of bullfighting known as course camarguaise?

options.text: Bulls are running from the arena to the fields through the village.
Bulls are running from the fields to the arena through the village.
Bulls are enclosed in some streets in order to be played with.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bulls are running from the fields to the arena through the village.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: July and Canada
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, festival, summer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This flower, depicted by French artist Claude Monet in a series of paintings, is the birth flower of July.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: water lily

questions.question: What is the meaning of the national motto of Canada, A Mari Usque Ad Mare?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: From sea to sea

questions.question: What is the official winter sport of Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ice hockey

questions.question: What animal was adopted as an official symbol of Canada on April 30, 2002?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canadian Horse

questions.question: What English rock band recorded the 1971 song July Morning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uriah Heep

questions.question: What Roman Emperor and founder of the Roman Empire gave the month of July its present name in honor of his mentor Julius Caesar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Augustus

questions.question: According to tradition, the weather on this saints feast day (15 July) will continue for forty days.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St Swithin

questions.question: What is the capital city of Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ottawa

questions.question: Previously, the month of July was called Quintillis in Latin. What does the word quintilis mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fifth

questions.question: The events of this Spanish festival, held annually from July 6 to July 14, were central to the plot of The Sun Also Rises, by Ernest Hemingway.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The festival of San Fermín

questions.question: Leadvile, Colorado was biggest in what ore besides gold?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silver

questions.question: What English poet, noted for his narrative poem Childe Harolds Pilgrimage, once wrote “The English winter - ending in July, To recommence in August”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord Byron

questions.question: What countrys National Day is celebrated on 14th of July, commemorating an event which occurred on the morning of 14 July 1789?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: What description refers to the brightest and most valuable red of Julys gemstone, the ruby?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: pigeon-blood red

questions.question: What is the name given to the hottest, most sultry days of summer, typically experienced in the month of July?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dog Days
